pr_title: Implemented front end browser-based UI tests #733

timeline.message:
Added Cypress tests to OpenRefine
* Installed Cypress
* Added a few tests to cover basic OR features
Y
Refactored and enriched undo/redo tests, added extract & apply
Removed the cypress-dot-env plugin, as Cypress now supports nice configuration capabilities

timeline.bodyText:
It would be good to have a link to the setup instructions here too, because if I just clone the repository and run this command, it does not work out of the box:
yarn run v1.13.0
warning package.json: No license field
error Command "cypress" not found.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
timeline.author: wetneb
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -61,6 +61,11 @@ If you want to run only the server side portion of the tests, use:
 ./refine server_test
 ```
 
+If you want to run only the client side portion of the tests, use:
+```shell
+yarn --cwd ./main/tests/cypress run cypress open
+```

timeline.bodyText:
This page does not seem to be accessible from the sidebar yet. Also, the rendering is a bit funny at the moment:
https://deploy-preview-3340--openrefine-docs.netlify.app/technical-reference/functional-tests/
Perhaps because of the first newline in the file, which fails the parsing of this metadata?
timeline.author: wetneb

timeline.bodyText:
Yarn complains about the absence of a license field in this file, I think:
yarn install
yarn install v1.13.0
warning package.json: No license field
warning No license field

You can use the same license as the rest of the code, BSD 3-clause
timeline.author: wetneb

timeline.message: Improved functional tests documentation, added license and description to tests package.json
